data.title: Harpo Marx
data.text:
AKA Adolph Marx

Born: 23-Nov-1888

Birthplace: New York City

Died: 28-Sep-1964

Location of death: Los Angeles, CA

Cause of death: Heart Failure

Remains: Cremated, Sand trap, Rancho Mirage Golf Course

Gender: Male

Religion: Jewish

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: Silent harp-playing Marx Brother

Father: Sam Marx (b. 1861, d. 10-May-1933)

Mother: Minnie Marx

Brother: Groucho Marx (actor)

Brother: Gummo Marx (actor)

Brother: Zeppo Marx (actor)

Brother: Chico Marx (actor)

Wife: Susan Fleming (actress, m. 28-Sep-1936, until his death)

Son: Bill Marx (actor, adopted)

Son: Alexander Marx (adopted)

Son: Jim Marx (adopted)

Daughter: Minnie Marx (adopted)

Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

Open Heart Surgery

Algonquin Round Table

Marx Brothers

Endorsement of Smirnoff Vodka 1961

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

The Story of Mankind (8-Nov-1957) · Isaac Newton

Love Happy (12-Oct-1949) · Harpo

A Night in Casablanca (10-May-1946) · Rusty

Stage Door Canteen (24-Jun-1943) · Himself

The Big Store (20-Jun-1941)

Go West (6-Dec-1940) · Rusty Panello

At the Circus (20-Oct-1939) · Punchy

Room Service (30-Sep-1938) · Faker

A Day at the Races (11-Jun-1937) · Stuffy

A Night at the Opera (15-Nov-1935) · Tomasso

Duck Soup (17-Nov-1933) · Pinky

Horse Feathers (10-Aug-1932) · Pinky

Monkey Business (19-Sep-1931) · Harpo

Animal Crackers (28-Aug-1930) · The Professor

The Cocoanuts (3-May-1929)

Official Website:

http://www.harposplace.com/
